statement.text: Post-revascularization surveillance for mesenteric ischemia employs mesenteric duplex ultrasound to detect restenosis before symptom recurrence or thrombosis, with recommended intervals of every 3-6 months in the first year and annually thereafter, aiming to identify lesions amenable to elective reintervention.
statement.formal: Surveillance Protocol: Baseline duplex (1 month) → Every 3-6 months (year 1) → Annually (thereafter) → Reintervention if significant restenosis

explanation.intuition: After revascularization, the repaired vessel can develop new blockages - either from scarring (intimal hyperplasia) or progressive atherosclerosis. Regular check-ups with ultrasound can catch these problems while they're still mild, allowing planned reintervention before the patient has another crisis.
explanation.key_insight: Surveillance is particularly important after endovascular treatment, which has higher restenosis rates than open bypass. Detecting in-stent restenosis before complete occlusion allows for elective repeat intervention, avoiding the high-risk scenario of acute-on-chronic mesenteric ischemia.

technique.views: Sagittal and transverse aorta, celiac, SMA origins

CT_angiography.indication: Abnormal duplex, recurrent symptoms, bypass assessment
CT_angiography.limitations: Radiation, contrast, not for routine surveillance

after_endovascular.rationale: Higher restenosis rate, need for closer monitoring

after_open_bypass.rationale: Lower restenosis rate but graft degeneration can occur

after_acute_episode.additional_monitoring: May need more frequent imaging if extensive resection or ongoing nutritional issues

approach_to_reintervention.endovascular_restenosis: Repeat angioplasty ± stenting usually first choice
approach_to_reintervention.bypass_stenosis: Consider surgical revision for proximal or distal lesions
approach_to_reintervention.occlusion: May need new bypass or alternative approach

outcomes_of_surveillance.impact_of_surveillance: Early detection allows elective reintervention, avoiding emergency surgery

sources.citation: SVS guidelines on chronic mesenteric ischemia surveillance
Defined review on mesenteric duplex surveillance

learning_objectives: Understand the rationale for post-revascularization surveillance
Know duplex velocity criteria for restenosis
clinical_pearls: Surveillance matters more after stenting than after bypass
Fasting is essential for good duplex quality
Asymptomatic restenosis still warrants consideration of reintervention
Don't wait for symptoms - the goal is to prevent acute-on-chronic crises
